CatDescriptText: Mr. Leonard Brinsky, 38 Greenley Street was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you believe in corporal (paddling) punishment for students, in elementary grades, who misbehave? If so, who should mete [sic]  out the punishment-- the teacher or the principal?" answer reads: "I don't think so, because it leaves a fear which continues in later life, a fear of being hit.  The pupils should be talked to, not punished for misbehaving."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Leonard Brinsky wearing dark zippered suede jacket, standing in front of diner or restaurant entrance with sign for Whitman's Chocolates and Lance, and neon sign for Money Orders
